Finding AidThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2017-09-07T14:50:41Description is in English.
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Socialist Minute Books (New York, N.Y.) TAM.056.001
3 Linear Feet (7 boxes)
1872-1907 The Socialist Party (U.S.), founded in 1901, attracted numerous individuals and/or splinter groups from other socialist groupings. With these individuals/groups in the New York metropolitan area came portions of the records of several socialist organizations, notably the minute books from the Socialist Labor Party, the Social Democratic Party (and from other organizations) that comprise this collection. Note: the collection has been microfilmed, and researchers must use the microfilm copy (R-7124, reels 1-2).
Existence and Location of Copies note
This collection is available on microfilm (Film R-7124, Reels 1-2) for use in this repository only. Researchers must use microfilm for this collection.
Provenance
Transferred from the Rand School Archives, 1962.
Access Restrictions
Open for research without restrictions. However, patrons must use microfilm (Film R-7124, Reels 1-2).
Historical/Biographical Note
The Socialist Party (U.S.), founded in 1901, attracted numerous individuals and/or splinter groups from other socialist groupings. With these individuals/groups in the New York metropolitan area came portions of the records of several socialist organizations, and it is these materials that comprise this collection.
Scope and Content Note
The Socialist Minute Books, 1872 1907, consist of 32 volumes pertaining to the Socialist Labor Party, Social Democratic Party, and other socialist organizations. The volumes in this collection have been assigned frame numbers, 1-31; volume 14 has a supplementary volume with the frame number, 14a. The frame numbers and the title of each volume is located in the complete reel list which follows this description of the arrangement of the collection. The researcher should also note that an error was made in the targeting for this collection. On each frame, the word "Series" appears adjacent to the frame number. This term should actually be interpreted as "Collection".
Arrangement
Folders are arranged chronologically.
The files are grouped into 1 series:
Missing Title

Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number;

New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.
